Class Twooter

  • java.lang.Object
    • Twooter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, twooter.UpdateListener

    public class Twooter
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, twooter.UpdateListener
    This class represents the code that runs behind the front-end. It also acts as a client to the Twooter API, bridging between the information on the server side and the user.
    See Also:
    TwooterGUI

    • Constructor Detail

      • Twooter

        public Twooter()
        Constructor method. Immediately instantiates the client side code and the GUI, before proceeding to allow the user to log in.

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        The method that runs whenever a button is clicked. It selects between the potential buttons by comparing the source of the event with the accessor methods of the unique buttons. It then runs functions that correspond to that button. For instance, hitting the "Submit" button sends the user's login info to the server and begins setting up the GUI for the main page of the app.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - The event caused by the button clicked

      • submitLogin

        public void submitLogin()
        Method that sends off the username and token to the server. It also reads the previous login details from a text file stored with the .jar files.

      • checkForFile

        public boolean checkForFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Method that checks if a file exists.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file the code is looking for.
        Returns:
        true or false depending on whether the file exists or not.

      • readFromFile

        public java.lang.String readFromFile(java.lang.String name)
        A method that reads from a text file, used to obtain login information and
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file once it is saved (i.e. name.txt)
        Returns:
        result, the entire string in the text file

      • createNewFile

        public void createNewFile(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String input)
        Method that creates a .txt file if none exists already and prints some text to it
        Parameters:
        name - name of the file to be created
        input - text to be stored in the file

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String input)
        A procedure that writes a string to a pre-exsting file.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file to be edited
        input - the string to be entered into the file

      • getToken

        public java.lang.String getToken()
        A function that retrieves the token from the server based on the input username; if it is a valid, available username, it will return a token, otherwise it will return null
        Returns:
        token that corresponds to the new username, or null if username is invalid

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage()

      • retrieveMessages

        public void retrieveMessages()
        Procedure that sends the last 30 messages from the server to the GUI to be output

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the live feed service

      • updateMessagesList

        public void updateMessagesList()
        Updates the list of messages from the live feed

      • handleUpdate

        public void handleUpdate(twooter.TwooterEvent e)
        This runs on prompt from the server. Every time something changes server side, it sends an even to this handler.
        Specified by:
        handleUpdate in interface twooter.UpdateListener
        Parameters:
        e - The event flagged by the action

      • checkIfIsUp

        public boolean checkIfIsUp()
        Checks if the server is up
        Returns:
        true if it is, false if not

      • getUsers

        public void getUsers()
        Procedure that updates the list of users displayed on the UI

      • followUser

        public void followUser(java.lang.String user)
        Procedure that allows the user to follow other users. It writes the followed users into a text file so the follows aren't lost when the program is closed.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to be followed

      • getFollowing

        public void getFollowing()
        Adds the followed users to the GUI for the user's benefit It then refreshes the GUI and displays the info
